skill.name: MuleRouter
skill.description: Generates images and videos using MuleRouter or MuleRun multimodal APIs. Text-to-Image, Image-to-Image, Text-to-Video, Image-to-Video, video editing (VACE, keyframe interpolation). Use when the user wants to generate, edit, or transform images and videos using AI models like Wan2.6 or Nano Banana.
skill.summary: Generate images and videos using AI models through MuleRouter/MuleRun APIs
skill.author: OpenMule

security_audit.summary: This skill is a legitimate AI model client with 100% false positive rate on static analysis. All findings are dismissed: 'weak crypto' flags are plain text descriptions, 'external commands' are documentation examples, and 'dangerous combinations' are standard API client patterns. The skill properly manages credentials via environment variables and accesses documented API endpoints.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [CRITICAL] obfuscation: DANGEROUS COMBINATION: Code execution + Network + Credential access
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: The skill accesses credentials (environment variables) and makes network requests - this is standard API client behavior, not malicious. The API key is only used for authentication with the intended MuleRouter/MuleRun services. No data exfiltration occurs.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [HIGH] obfuscation: SUSPICIOUS COMBINATION: Filesystem + Credentials + Network
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Filesystem access is for loading .env configuration files. This is standard configuration management, not suspicious activity. Credential access is only for API authentication.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [HIGH] blocker: Weak cryptographic algorithm (200+ occurrences across model files)
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: The static scanner incorrectly flagged string literals and description text as cryptographic algorithms. Line 23 in generation files contains description strings like 'Generate videos from text prompts', not crypto code. No cryptographic code exists in this repository.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [MEDIUM] external_commands: Ruby/shell backtick execution (80+ occurrences in markdown files)
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: All flagged locations are in documentation files (README.md, SKILL.md, references/*.md). These contain example shell commands in code blocks showing how to use the skill. They are documentation examples, not executable code.

The flagged locations contain placeholder text like 'your-api-key' in documentation. These are user instructions showing where to insert their own API key, not actual secrets. The skill uses os.getenv() to read credentials securely.

Loading .env files is standard configuration management practice using python-dotenv. The skill explicitly documents this as the intended configuration method. No sensitive data is being accessed without authorization.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [LOW] network: HTTP client library / Hardcoded URL
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: The httpx library is a standard HTTP client. Hardcoded URLs are the legitimate API endpoints (api.mulerouter.ai, api.mulerun.com) documented in the skill. No unauthorized network destinations.
Dynamic imports are used to load model modules from disk at runtime. This is a legitimate pattern for plugin/module discovery. The paths are controlled, not user-controlled input.
Functions like sys.path manipulation and Path() operations are standard Python practices for module discovery. Not reconnaissance - simply required for the plugin architecture.

content.user_title: Generate images and videos with AI
content.value_statement: Create visual content using AI models through simple text prompts. Supports text-to-image, text-to-video, image-to-video, and video editing workflows with multiple model options.
actual_capabilities: Generate images from text prompts using AI models like Wan2.6 and Nano Banana
Create videos from text descriptions with configurable duration and resolution
Transform images to video with effects and edits
List available models and parameters for each model
Poll task status and retrieve generated content URLs
Support both MuleRouter and MuleRun API endpoints
limitations: Requires valid API key for MuleRouter or MuleRun service
Generation times vary from 5 minutes (images) to 15 minutes (videos)
Output returns URLs to generated content, not local files
Models and parameters are predefined by the API providers

use_cases.title: Create AI-generated visuals
use_cases.description: Generate marketing images and social media videos from text descriptions quickly

use_cases.title: Add media to applications
use_cases.description: Generate placeholder images and videos for testing or prototyping applications

use_cases.title: Explore creative concepts
use_cases.description: Generate video concepts and image variations for creative projects

prompt_templates.title: Simple image generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate an image of a sunset over mountains with orange and purple colors

prompt_templates.title: Video with options
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a 10-second video of a dog running on a beach at 1280x720 resolution

prompt_templates.title: Image transformation
prompt_templates.prompt: Transform this image into a video with gentle zoom effect: https://example.com/input.jpg

prompt_templates.title: Batch operations
prompt_templates.prompt: List all available models for video generation and show their parameters

output_examples.input: Generate a video of a cat walking through a garden

best_practices: Set MULEROUTER_SITE and MULEROUTER_API_KEY environment variables before use
Use --list-params to explore available parameters for each model
Set appropriate timeout: 5 minutes for images, 15 minutes for videos
Check --quiet flag when integrating with other tools to reduce output
anti_patterns: Do not hardcode API keys in scripts or share them in version control
Do not set max_wait too low for video generation (minimum 600 seconds recommended)
Do not skip validation of generated content URLs before using them
Do not ignore rate limit errors (HTTP 429) - implement proper backoff

faq.question: How do I get an API key?
faq.answer: Sign up at mulerouter.ai or mulerun.com to receive an API key. Set MULEROUTER_API_KEY environment variable.

faq.question: What models are available?
faq.answer: Run uv run python scripts/list_models.py to see all available models from Alibaba and Google providers.

faq.question: How long does generation take?
faq.answer: Image generation takes about 5 minutes. Video generation takes 10-15 minutes depending on length.

faq.question: Can I use my own images?
faq.answer: Yes, for image-to-video and image-to-image tasks. Provide image URLs in the --images parameter.

faq.question: What is the difference between MuleRouter and MuleRun?
faq.answer: Both use the same API format with the same models. Set MULEROUTER_SITE to choose which endpoint to use.

faq.question: How do I save generated content?
faq.answer: The API returns URLs to generated content. Download the files using standard HTTP requests.
